definition: to be a suspect (in a crime)/to be suspected of
to wade/to be involved/to concern/to experience/to enter (classical)
to dislike/suspicion/resentment/enmity/abbr. for 嫌犯[xian2 fan4], criminal suspect
(criminal) suspect

sentences.english: Your account was initially thought to be involved in carder activity .
sentences.chinese: 最初我們認爲你的賬戶涉嫌信用卡欺詐。

sentences.english: The suspect who fled was arrested on suspicion of being drunk in public and resisting arrest.
sentences.chinese: 逃走的那名嫌犯因涉嫌公然酗酒及拒捕而遭到逮捕。

sentences.english: There have even been high-ranking government officials arrested for taking bribes from drug traffickers.
sentences.chinese: 甚至有高級政府官員因涉嫌收受毒販賄賂而被捕。

sentences.english: At present, the suspicion of intentional homicide, Chen has been approved by the prosecution to arrest.
sentences.chinese: 目前，因涉嫌故意殺人罪，陳某已被檢方批准逮捕。

sentences.english: The suspected criminal is being hunted by police following a burglary in Swansea in September.
sentences.chinese: 這名疑犯因涉嫌九月份在斯旺西行竊被警方通緝。

sentences.english: But I am still suspect for crime against the radiation safety law.
sentences.chinese: 可我目前仍是一名涉嫌違反核輻射安全法的嫌疑犯。

sentences.english: France 'to criminalize shouting at your wife'.
sentences.chinese: 丈夫辱罵妻子將涉嫌違法。

sentences.english: The banker absconded with embezzled funds.
sentences.chinese: 那個銀行家涉嫌盜用資金。

sentences.english: Officers should also act with restraint before freezing the account of an operating firm suspected of committing crimes, according to Zheng.
sentences.chinese: 對涉嫌犯罪企業的正常經營賬戶要慎用凍結措施。

sentences.english: China detains chief suspect in steel exec's death.
sentences.chinese: 涉嫌毆打通話鋼廠總經理致死的嫌犯在長春被捕。

sentences.english: They accused suspected of producing and selling fake and inferior products, the crime of illegal business operation.
sentences.chinese: 他們指控涉嫌生產和銷售假冒僞劣產品，非法經營罪。

sentences.english: Rajaratnam has gone on trial for allegedly masterminding an insider-trading ring.
sentences.chinese: 而拉賈拉特南已經因涉嫌策劃一個內部交易圈而受審。

sentences.english: The men were pulled in on suspicion of having committed a burglary.
sentences.chinese: 這些人因涉嫌犯有夜盜罪而被拘留。

sentences.english: The teenagers are suspected of being involved in the crime.
sentences.chinese: 這些少年涉嫌於這宗案件。

sentences.english: Ms. Brooks was arrested Sunday on suspicion of phone hacking and making corrupt payments to police.
sentences.chinese: 布魯克斯因涉嫌電話竊聽和賄賂警察而於週日被捕。

sentences.english: The fellow who was suspected of killing his wife was finally hurled into prison.
sentences.chinese: 那個涉嫌殺害其妻的傢伙最終被迫入獄。

definition: illegal/to break the law
illegal
accusation/a (criminal) charge/to accuse
to file for investigation/to prosecute (a case)
(law) obstructing government administration
to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
criminal offense
upon investigation
legal (proceedings)/according to law
to detain as criminal/criminal detention/abbr. for 刑事拘留[xing2 shi4 ju1 liu2]
to raise a charge/to sue/to institute proceedings
to track down and seize (a criminal suspect, contraband etc)
(legal) case/incident/record/file/table
suspicion/to have suspicions
to make a full confession/to plead guilty
(of a perpetrator, victim, weapon, sum of money etc) to be involved in the case
